values.description:
Modifications:

* On Windows put all build executable and dll in build/bin, to make sure that the test executables find all the dll that they need to run \(only on Windows to avoid  creating problems for all the places in  which the location of the tests as  `${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}` is hardcoded 
* Do not set PATH via ENVIROMENT argument of set\_tests\_properties, apparently on Windows it causes the path to fail
* Do not hardcode the location of the test executable \(the hardcoded location is wrong on multi-config generator such as Visual Studio\) but use instead the COMMAND argument of add\_test that automatically substitute a executable target with its absolute location
* Use correct path environment variable separators in Windows
* Do not run the \`check\_test\_ran.py\` script unless both the Python interpreter and xsltproc are available, and pass it to the  Python interpreter instead of hoping for the shebang to work

‌
values.title: Support for running tests on Windows

summary.raw:
Modifications:

* On Windows put all build executable and dll in build/bin, to make sure that the test executables find all the dll that they need to run \(only on Windows to avoid  creating problems for all the places in  which the location of the tests as  `${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}` is hardcoded 
* Do not set PATH via ENVIROMENT argument of set\_tests\_properties, apparently on Windows it causes the path to fail
* Do not hardcode the location of the test executable \(the hardcoded location is wrong on multi-config generator such as Visual Studio\) but use instead the COMMAND argument of add\_test that automatically substitute a executable target with its absolute location
* Use correct path environment variable separators in Windows
* Do not run the \`check\_test\_ran.py\` script unless both the Python interpreter and xsltproc are available, and pass it to the  Python interpreter instead of hoping for the shebang to work

‌
summary.html:
Modifications:

  • On Windows put all build executable and dll in build/bin, to make sure that the test executables find all the dll that they need to run (only on Windows to avoid creating problems for all the places in which the location of the tests as ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR} is hardcoded
  • Do not set PATH via ENVIROMENT argument of set_tests_properties, apparently on Windows it causes the path to fail
  • Do not hardcode the location of the test executable (the hardcoded location is wrong on multi-config generator such as Visual Studio) but use instead the COMMAND argument of add_test that automatically substitute a executable target with its absolute location
  • Use correct path environment variable separators in Windows
  • Do not run the `check_test_ran.py` script unless both the Python interpreter and xsltproc are available, and pass it to the Python interpreter instead of hoping for the shebang to work

‌

values.description:
Since Ogre 1.11, the default mode of resource retrieval in Ogre \(and so the one typically used by packages when they compiler their version of Ogre\) is “STRICT search in default group if not specified otherwise. Case sensitive lookup.“ \(see [https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.11.0/CMakeLists.txt#L316](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.11.0/CMakeLists.txt#L316) \). 

This means that in the \`Ogre::FontManager::getByName\` method only resources that  are added in the default group \(i.e. `”Default”`\) are found.  Unfortunately the fonts that used by Gazebo are in a directory that is added in the `”Fonts”` group in [#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc#lines-603](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc#lines-603) ,  so they are not loaded in Ogre >= 1.11 . 

By explicitly specifying the second argument of the `getByName` method  to be `Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::AUTODETECT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME`, i.e. its default value in the Ogre versions 1.7-1.9, we ensure that the behaviours of finding fonts is consistent across Ogre versions. 

Related  Ogre docs: 

* [https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/\_resource-\_management.html](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/latest/_resource-_management.html)
* `AUTODETECT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME` : [https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class\_ogre\_1\_1\_resource\_group\_manager.html#a2a3698b4303d782938455e649b2e22a2](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class_ogre_1_1_resource_group_manager.html#a2a3698b4303d782938455e649b2e22a2)
*  \`Ogre::FontManager::getByName\` in Ogre 1.12  : [https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class\_ogre\_1\_1\_font\_manager.html#ad9d0aad64d9ca654e6ba73a2e7ec1fda](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class_ogre_1_1_font_manager.html#ad9d0aad64d9ca654e6ba73a2e7ec1fda) 
*  \`Ogre::FontManager::getByName\` in  Ogre 1.9 : [https://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class\_ogre\_1\_1\_font\_manager.html#a7b24e0e816f6ae3eb138413f94838ba5](https://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_font_manager.html#a7b24e0e816f6ae3eb138413f94838ba5) 

Without this fix, tryng to open the “Apply External Wrench” windows resulted in the following error: 

‌

```
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 11.0.0~pre1
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.59
[Wrn] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\GuiIface.cc:119] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt.
You must not let any exception whatsoever propagate through Qt code.
If that is not possible, in Qt 5 you must at least reimplement
QCoreApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

[Wrn] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\GuiIface.cc:119] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt.
You must not let any exception whatsoever propagate through Qt code.
If that is not possible, in Qt 5 you must at least reimplement
QCoreApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

[Err] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\main.cc:34] Ogre Error: C Ö■⌂: Could not find font Arial in MovableText::setFontName
```

‌
values.title: Fix Ogre::FontManager::getByName use in Ogre >= 1.11

summary.raw:
Since Ogre 1.11, the default mode of resource retrieval in Ogre \(and so the one typically used by packages when they compiler their version of Ogre\) is “STRICT search in default group if not specified otherwise. Case sensitive lookup.“ \(see [https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.11.0/CMakeLists.txt#L316](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.11.0/CMakeLists.txt#L316) \). 

This means that in the \`Ogre::FontManager::getByName\` method only resources that  are added in the default group \(i.e. `”Default”`\) are found.  Unfortunately the fonts that used by Gazebo are in a directory that is added in the `”Fonts”` group in [#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc#lines-603](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc#lines-603) ,  so they are not loaded in Ogre >= 1.11 . 

By explicitly specifying the second argument of the `getByName` method  to be `Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::AUTODETECT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME`, i.e. its default value in the Ogre versions 1.7-1.9, we ensure that the behaviours of finding fonts is consistent across Ogre versions. 

Related  Ogre docs: 

* [https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/\_resource-\_management.html](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/latest/_resource-_management.html)
* `AUTODETECT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME` : [https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class\_ogre\_1\_1\_resource\_group\_manager.html#a2a3698b4303d782938455e649b2e22a2](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class_ogre_1_1_resource_group_manager.html#a2a3698b4303d782938455e649b2e22a2)
*  \`Ogre::FontManager::getByName\` in Ogre 1.12  : [https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class\_ogre\_1\_1\_font\_manager.html#ad9d0aad64d9ca654e6ba73a2e7ec1fda](https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class_ogre_1_1_font_manager.html#ad9d0aad64d9ca654e6ba73a2e7ec1fda) 
*  \`Ogre::FontManager::getByName\` in  Ogre 1.9 : [https://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class\_ogre\_1\_1\_font\_manager.html#a7b24e0e816f6ae3eb138413f94838ba5](https://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_font_manager.html#a7b24e0e816f6ae3eb138413f94838ba5) 

Without this fix, tryng to open the “Apply External Wrench” windows resulted in the following error: 

‌

```
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 11.0.0~pre1
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.59
[Wrn] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\GuiIface.cc:119] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt.
You must not let any exception whatsoever propagate through Qt code.
If that is not possible, in Qt 5 you must at least reimplement
QCoreApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

[Wrn] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\GuiIface.cc:119] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt.
You must not let any exception whatsoever propagate through Qt code.
If that is not possible, in Qt 5 you must at least reimplement
QCoreApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

[Err] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\main.cc:34] Ogre Error: C Ö■⌂: Could not find font Arial in MovableText::setFontName
```

‌
summary.html:
Since Ogre 1.11, the default mode of resource retrieval in Ogre (and so the one typically used by packages when they compiler their version of Ogre) is “STRICT search in default group if not specified otherwise. Case sensitive lookup.“ (see https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/v1.11.0/CMakeLists.txt#L316 ).

This means that in the `Ogre::FontManager::getByName` method only resources that are added in the default group (i.e. ”Default”) are found. Unfortunately the fonts that used by Gazebo are in a directory that is added in the ”Fonts” group in #!/osrf/gazebo/src/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe/gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc#lines-603 , so they are not loaded in Ogre >= 1.11 .

By explicitly specifying the second argument of the getByName method to be Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::AUTODETECT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME, i.e. its default value in the Ogre versions 1.7-1.9, we ensure that the behaviours of finding fonts is consistent across Ogre versions.

Related Ogre docs:

  • https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/_resource-_management.html
  • AUTODETECT_RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME : https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class_ogre_1_1_resource_group_manager.html#a2a3698b4303d782938455e649b2e22a2
  • `Ogre::FontManager::getByName` in Ogre 1.12 : https://ogrecave.github.io/ogre/api/1.12/class_ogre_1_1_font_manager.html#ad9d0aad64d9ca654e6ba73a2e7ec1fda
  • `Ogre::FontManager::getByName` in Ogre 1.9 : https://www.ogre3d.org/docs/api/1.9/class_ogre_1_1_font_manager.html#a7b24e0e816f6ae3eb138413f94838ba5

Without this fix, tryng to open the “Apply External Wrench” windows resulted in the following error:

‌

Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 11.0.0~pre1
Copyright (C) 2012 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 192.168.1.59
[Wrn] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\GuiIface.cc:119] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt.
You must not let any exception whatsoever propagate through Qt code.
If that is not possible, in Qt 5 you must at least reimplement
QCoreApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

[Wrn] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\GuiIface.cc:119] Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt.
You must not let any exception whatsoever propagate through Qt code.
If that is not possible, in Qt 5 you must at least reimplement
QCoreApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

[Err] [C:\idjl-ws\src\gazebo\gazebo\gui\main.cc:34] Ogre Error: C Ö■⌂: Could not find font Arial in MovableText::setFontName

‌

values.description:
On Ogre < 1.13, the definition of OGRE\_PLUGIN\_DIR in the OGRE CMake configuration file on Windows is wrong.To avoid problems, on Windows we set OGRE\_PLUGINDIR manually.  
  
Note that this affects the  logic of handling OGRE on Windows and when it is not found with `pkg-config` , so it should be quite safe to merge it. Furthermore, beside the OGRE installed by `vcpkg` I also checked the OGRE installed by ROSOnWindows via Chocolatey \([https://roswin.azurewebsites.net/packages/ogre/](https://roswin.azurewebsites.net/packages/ogre/)\) and the binary available in the Windows docs \([https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/win32/deps/ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip](https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/win32/deps/ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip)\) and in both plugins are indeed installed in `${OGRE_PREFIX_DIR}/bin`, so we should safe even if those packages are used in an system without `pkg-config` .

See [https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/issues/1499](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/issues/1499) for more info.
values.title: Add workaround for OGRE issue 1499 on Windows without pkg-config

summary.raw:
On Ogre < 1.13, the definition of OGRE\_PLUGIN\_DIR in the OGRE CMake configuration file on Windows is wrong.To avoid problems, on Windows we set OGRE\_PLUGINDIR manually.  
  
Note that this affects the  logic of handling OGRE on Windows and when it is not found with `pkg-config` , so it should be quite safe to merge it. Furthermore, beside the OGRE installed by `vcpkg` I also checked the OGRE installed by ROSOnWindows via Chocolatey \([https://roswin.azurewebsites.net/packages/ogre/](https://roswin.azurewebsites.net/packages/ogre/)\) and the binary available in the Windows docs \([https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/win32/deps/ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip](https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/win32/deps/ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip)\) and in both plugins are indeed installed in `${OGRE_PREFIX_DIR}/bin`, so we should safe even if those packages are used in an system without `pkg-config` .

See [https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/issues/1499](https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/issues/1499) for more info.
summary.html:
On Ogre < 1.13, the definition of OGRE_PLUGIN_DIR in the OGRE CMake configuration file on Windows is wrong.To avoid problems, on Windows we set OGRE_PLUGINDIR manually.

Note that this affects the logic of handling OGRE on Windows and when it is not found with pkg-config , so it should be quite safe to merge it. Furthermore, beside the OGRE installed by vcpkg I also checked the OGRE installed by ROSOnWindows via Chocolatey (https://roswin.azurewebsites.net/packages/ogre/) and the binary available in the Windows docs (https://s3.amazonaws.com/osrf-distributions/win32/deps/ogre-sdk-1.10.12-vc15-x64.zip) and in both plugins are indeed installed in ${OGRE_PREFIX_DIR}/bin, so we should safe even if those packages are used in an system without pkg-config .

See https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/issues/1499 for more info.

values.description:
Backport pr #3201 to gazebo9. This is needed to fix homebrew build failures first noticed in the following comment:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3194/ahcorde-gazebo9-reflections/diff#comment-141767520
values.title: Fix problem with automoc in CMake 3.17 (backport to gazebo9)

summary.raw:

Backport pr #3201 to gazebo9. This is needed to fix homebrew build failures first noticed in the following comment:

values.title: Merge 9 -> 10

summary.html: Includes pr #3193, pr #3197, and pr #3206, the last of which fixes a build failure on homebrew.
Includes pr #3193, pr #3197. Checking CI.

values.description:
Several example plugins have been failing to compile on macOS with the same cmake automoc error that was fixed in pr #3201 / pr #3206:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/152/testReport/(root)/Plugins_ExamplesBuild_Plugins/Plugins_4/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/152/testReport/(root)/Plugins_ExamplesBuild_Plugins/Plugins_5/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/152/testReport/(root)/Plugins_ExamplesBuild_Plugins/Plugins_7/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/152/testReport/(root)/Plugins_ExamplesBuild_Plugins/Plugins_10/

~~~
601: [ RUN      ] Plugins/ExamplesBuild_Plugins.Plugins/4
601: mkdir /var/folders/2b/16z_v7913l96qk5m9g0v81kw0000gq/T/gui_overlay_plugin_spawn-feef-3654-0061-533e
601: source /Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/gazebo/examples/plugins/gui_overlay_plugin_spawn
...
601: CMake Warning (dev) in CMakeLists.txt:
601:   Policy CMP0100 is not set: Let AUTOMOC and AUTOUIC process .hh files.  Run
601:   "cmake --help-policy CMP0100" for policy details.  Use the cmake_policy
601:   command to set the policy and suppress this warning.
601: 
601:   For compatibility, CMake is excluding the header file(s):
601: 
601:     "/Users/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/gazebo/examples/plugins/gui_overlay_plugin_spawn/GUIExampleSpawnWidget.hh"
601: 
601:   from processing by AUTOMOC.  If any of the files should be processed, set
601:   CMP0100 to NEW.  If any of the files should not be processed, explicitly
601:   exclude them by setting the source file property SKIP_AUTOMOC:
601: 
601:     set_property(SOURCE file.hh PROPERTY SKIP_AUTOMOC ON)
601: 
601: This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.
...
601: [100%] Linking CXX shared library libgui_example_spawn_widget.dylib
601: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
601:   "gazebo::GUIExampleSpawnWidget::staticMetaObject", referenced from:
601:       gazebo::GUIExampleSpawnWidget::tr(char const*, char const*, int) in GUIExampleSpawnWidget.cc.o
601:   "vtable for gazebo::GUIExampleSpawnWidget", referenced from:
601:       gazebo::GUIExampleSpawnWidget::GUIExampleSpawnWidget() in GUIExampleSpawnWidget.cc.o
601:       gazebo::GUIExampleSpawnWidget::~GUIExampleSpawnWidget() in GUIExampleSpawnWidget.cc.o
601:   NOTE: a missing vtable usually means the first non-inline virtual member function has no definition.
601: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
601: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
~~~

The fix from pr #3201 is applied to these examples in c4ad830.

Even with that fixed, three of the plugins were still failing with a compiler error that was reported in #2681, so that same fix is applied to the examples in ab2acbd, and now those example plugins should compile successfully on macOS.

There are some other compilation errors of examples related to boost and pkg-config, but that is out of scope for this PR.
values.title: Fix macOS gui examples compilation

The fix from pr #3201 is applied to these examples in c4ad830.

Even with that fixed, three of the plugins were still failing with a compiler error that was reported in #2681, so that same fix is applied to the examples in ab2acbd, and now those example plugins should compile successfully on macOS.

There are some other compilation errors of examples related to boost and pkg-config, but that is out of scope for this PR.

Several example plugins have been failing to compile on macOS with the same cmake automoc error that was fixed in pr #3201 / pr #3206:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/152/testReport/(root)/Plugins_ExamplesBuild_Plugins/Plugins_4/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-gazebo9-homebrew-amd64/152/testReport/(root)/Plugins_ExamplesBuild_Plugins/Plugins_5/

The fix from pr #3201 is applied to these examples in c4ad830.

Even with that fixed, three of the plugins were still failing with a compiler error that was reported in #2681, so that same fix is applied to the examples in ab2acbd, and now those example plugins should compile successfully on macOS.

There are some other compilation errors of examples related to boost and pkg-config, but that is out of scope for this PR.

values.description:
The HeightmapShape class needs to expose a SetHeight\(\) method. The method would be used to update the height values of the HeightmapShape object such that it would match the heigh values of the scene when they have been modified.

‌

For a demonstration on how this would be used please refer to this repository \(_update-collision_ _branch_\): [https://github.com/Samahu/robotics-dynamic-terrain/tree/update-collision](https://github.com/Samahu/robotics-dynamic-terrain/tree/update-collision)
values.title: Add SetHeight method to HeightmapShape class

summary.raw:
The HeightmapShape class needs to expose a SetHeight\(\) method. The method would be used to update the height values of the HeightmapShape object such that it would match the heigh values of the scene when they have been modified.

‌

For a demonstration on how this would be used please refer to this repository \(_update-collision_ _branch_\): [https://github.com/Samahu/robotics-dynamic-terrain/tree/update-collision](https://github.com/Samahu/robotics-dynamic-terrain/tree/update-collision)
summary.html:
The HeightmapShape class needs to expose a SetHeight() method. The method would be used to update the height values of the HeightmapShape object such that it would match the heigh values of the scene when they have been modified.

‌

For a demonstration on how this would be used please refer to this repository (update-collision branch): https://github.com/Samahu/robotics-dynamic-terrain/tree/update-collision
